jobs.title: Team Lead, Account Management Strategy and Execution
jobs.description:
**This is Adyen**



Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H\&M, and Microsoft \- making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.



For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.


**Team Lead, Account Management Strategy and Execution**



As a Team Lead in Account Management Strategy and Execution, you will play a pivotal role in driving the strategic direction and operational efficiency of our account management team. You will lead a team focused on optimizing our account management processes, enhancing customer value, and fostering strong client relationships. This role requires a blend of strategic thinking, analytical prowess, and a passion for developing both people and processes.


**What You'll Do:**


* **Strategy Development and Implementation:**
* + Contribute to the overall account management strategy, aligning it with company goals and market opportunities
	+ Design and implement strategic programs and initiatives to improve account management effectiveness and efficiency
	+ Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices to optimize the customer journey
	+ Serve as a partner to leadership including projects and leadership off\-sites
* **Team Leadership and Development:**
* + Lead, mentor, and coach a small team of strategy \& execution managers, fostering a high\-performing and collaborative environment
	+ Set clear objectives, provide regular feedback, and support the professional growth of team members
	+ Promote collaboration and knowledge sharing within the broader function and across departments
* **Operational Excellence:**
* + Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track team performance and identify areas for improvement
	+ Develop and maintain accurate revenue forecasting models alongside Finance
	+ Drive headcount planning with leadership
	+ Streamline workflows, leverage technology, and implement automation to enhance productivity
* **Cross\-functional Collaboration:**
* + Partner with sales, marketing, product, and other teams to ensure alignment and effective execution of account management strategies

**Who You Are:**


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, or a related field.
* Combination of
* + 3\+ years of experience in strategy consulting, investment banking, or a related strategy and analytics role, with a proven track record of success.
	+ 3\+ years of experience in account management, customer success, or other customer relationship role
	+ 2\+ years of experience in a team lead or supervisory role, with a passion for developing and motivating teams.
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to drive deep analytics and translate data into actionable insights
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and relationship\-building skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels
* Proficiency in CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) and data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Looker)
* Proactive and results\-oriented mindset, with a focus on driving customer value and achieving business objectives


**Other Job Details:**


* Strong preference for this role to be based out of our San Francisco, New York or Amsterdam offices
* Full\-time position with a minimum of 40 hours/week
* Some domestic and international travel required


*For San Francisco and New York, the annual base salary range for this role is $175,000 \- 230,000; to learn more about our compensation philosophy, please click* *here**.*


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**



Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them \- voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.



Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!


**What's next?**



Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.


*Adyen is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.*


*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.*

jobs.title: Strategic Partner Manager - Los Angeles - Otter
jobs.description:
**Strategic Partnership Manager**


**Location:** Los Angeles, CA


**Reports to:** Business Development Manager


**About Otter**



At **TryOtter.com**, we’re building the backbone of restaurant technology—helping operators streamline delivery, POS, and operations through a single powerful platform. Backed by Uber co\-founder Travis Kalanick, we’re scaling globally and partnering with the world’s most innovative restaurant brands and tech platforms.


**About the Role**



We’re seeking a **Strategic Partnership Manager** to help source, negotiate, and grow high\-impact partnerships that unlock revenue, drive growth, and scale Otter’s restaurant ecosystem. This role is ideal for a sharp, analytical business developer who thrives in fast\-paced environments and knows how to turn relationships into results.


**What You’ll Do**


* **Source, validate, negotiate, and sign** strategic partners across your regional market (US\&C, LATAM, EMEA, or APAC).
* **Own the full partner lifecycle**—from discovery and commercial structuring to onboarding and performance growth.
* **Collaborate cross\-functionally** with Sales Ops, Marketing, Kitchens, and Product teams to operationalize new initiatives and ensure internal alignment.
* **Develop strategic partner plans** that include creative go\-to\-market ideas, co\-branded initiatives, and measurable outcomes.
* **Track and prioritize opportunities** using structured frameworks and communicate status updates clearly to leadership.
* **Lead execution** of partnership initiatives—including performance reviews, joint marketing campaigns, and training rollouts.
* **Represent Otter** in partner\-facing conversations, often engaging with senior leaders at fast\-growing restaurant tech firms or marketplaces.


**What We’re Looking For**


* 5–7 years of relevant experience in **business development, partnerships, or alliances** at high\-growth software or marketplace companies
* Proven ability to **negotiate commercial terms** and navigate complex deal cycles
* Confident communicator who can lead executive\-level conversations and influence cross\-functional stakeholders
* Experience evaluating API integrations and technical feasibility of joint initiatives
* Data\-driven thinker with the ability to **identify trends, prioritize opportunities**, and execute quickly
* A “hustler” and an “enabler”—you thrive on ownership, moving fast, and scaling impact
* **A natural relationship builder who can establish trust and rapport with partners of all sizes.**
* **Experience with ISOs, POS resellers, or within the restaurant tech/payments ecosystem is a strong plus.**
* Bachelor’s degree required; technical fluency is a plus


**Preferred Backgrounds**



Experience at companies like DoorDash, Uber, Stripe, Salesforce, Toast, Shopify, Google, Twilio, or Meta is highly valued.


**Why Otter**


* Work at a hyper\-growth startup backed by category\-defining leadership
* Build partnerships with global scope and massive market potential
* High visibility and impact—your work directly drives company growth
* Collaborate with smart, scrappy, and driven teammates


**Ready to build the future of restaurant tech with us?**



Apply now at www.tryotter.com/careers

jobs.title: Senior Partner Growth Manager
jobs.description:
**The Company**  

Cover Genius is a Series E insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Uber, Hopper, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee. Our partners integrate with XCover, our award\-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year.

Our team and products have been recognized with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times which ranked Cover Genius as the \#1 fastest\-growing company in APAC in 2020\. Our diverse team across 20\+ countries and many language groups commit itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities. **Our People are**
Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired **Our People are not**
Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious  

As a Partner Growth Manager on our Ticketing Team, you will own key relationships with global partners in the live entertainment space, working with them to identify additional revenue opportunities then project managing the required changes with internal and external teams.  

To drive success in this role, you will have a successful track record in developing and executing growth strategies. As a Partner Growth Manager you will deliver solutions based on conversion optimization best practices during new partner integrations and with existing partners. You will identify growth opportunities and develop new and creative growth strategies to further increase our partner’s total transaction value or insurance revenue. Regular collaboration with Client Solution Engineers, Account Managers, Data Scientists and Designers will be key in ensuring partner growth initiatives goals are achieved.
### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Deep understanding of web user experience (esp. conversion rate and landing page optimization, pricing strategy, user journeys).
* Design, execute, and measure conversion and price optimization experiments to further optimize yield.
* Collaborate with designers and other team members to create landing pages and optimize user experience.
* Identify insights, trends and correlations, and optimize performance based on those findings.
* Evaluate emerging best practices and optimization strategies.
* Provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate.
* Own the solution design of the integration process and work with partners to design the most optimize solution.
* Develop trusted advisor status and strong relationships with partners and related stakeholders.
* Monitor solution data, analyze and forecast where possible. Provide commentary or advice to partners accordingly.
* Use data to monitor and identify adoption and utilization trends, as well as identify areas for improvement and growth.

### **What you will bring:**

* At least 3\-4 years experience and a demonstrated passion for growth hacking techniques.
* Experience in high growth B2C firms in either Design, Product or Marketing roles.
* Experience in data analysis and providing commentary would be advantageous.
* Experience in client or partner\-facing roles or considerable exposure to executives and founders would be advantageous.
* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, A postgraduate degree and/or record of academic achievement is also desirable.

### **Proficiencies and Attributes:**

* Strong people, communication and project management skills.
* Expert problem\-solving skills.
* Passion for enhancing systems, processes and feedback loops.
* An interest in the live entertainment and ticketing industry.

**Why Cover Genius?**  

Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?* **Flexible PTO.** Taking time out is important for our teams to enjoy life and stay fresh.
* **Employee Stock Options** \- we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world\-class company.
* **Work with like\-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back.** Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
* **Social Initiatives** \- pictures speak a thousand words!

  

Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!* *Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.*

* *The cash compensation range for this role is $125,000 \- $165,000\.*

jobs.title: Head of West Territory Operations
jobs.description:
**About the Role**
  

  

Uber Eats is transforming instant delivery and simplifying dining. Working at Uber Eats means unlocking opportunities for customers, merchants, and delivery partners alike.
  

  

We are seeking an exceptional individual to lead our Territory Operations team for the West territory. If you're passionate about designing and building innovative solutions to complex problems, this could be the role for you.
  

  

As the Head of Territory Operations for the West, you will be a key partner to the GM in shaping the strategy for the market and managing the growth and budget of the Territory. As a member of the West leadership team you will collaborate with West Commercial leadership and Strategic Operations leadership to develop scaled and strategic operations to grow the Eats business. You will manage a team of 7 operations managers to execute priorities and measure results, and your responsibilities will cover all parts of the Eats marketplace (eaters, couriers, restaurants and policy).
  

  

**What You'll Do**
* Coordinate Strategy and standardize execution across priority geographies: Implement scalable strategies and processes to maintain consistency and efficiency across all territories. Align Strategic Operations teams to ensure a unified, cohesive operational strategy while adapting to local market needs.
* Drive Hyperlocal Consumer Growth: Use data\-driven insights and marketing efforts to boost demand, optimize pricing, and enhance customer engagement in key areas.
* Ensure Hyperlocal Operational Success: Optimize merchant performance and courier supply, addressing operational challenges to improve service reliability.
* Support \& Align Commercial Teams: Provide operational insights and infrastructure support to Sales and Account Management, ensuring their strategies align with the geo\-specific landscape.
* Ensure our business is optimized from a regulatory perspective
* Lead and develop a team of Eater, Merchant, and Courier operators
* Set vision and develop strategy around operations and experience within a territory
* Enable commercial motions of the territory through tooling and tracking
* Provide input on local business need or how regulation impacts processes or products
* Work with AM Managers, Sales Managers, Territory Leads, the West Head of Acquisition, and GMs to help identify, solve, or escalate issues that relate to net new sales, existing merchant expansion, geo prioritization, and account investment and operations
* Voice business needs and opportunities with Strategic Operations leaders
* Track performance against OKRs across the territory
* Plan and manage multi\-city and territory\-wide initiatives
* Oversee any territory\-specific processes or campaigns needed in addition to or instead of nationally scaled ones
* Engage cross functional partners to lead or play a role in larger scale projects

**Basic Qualifications*** 6\+ years of professional work experience in a related field (consulting, operations, strategy, analytics, tech, investment banking)
* Bachelor degree required

**Preferred Qualifications*** Strong experience building and leading diverse teams
* Unparalleled business judgment and critical thinking skills with the ability to use data to quickly establish the highest value priorities and develop a strategy to pursue them
* Strong collaboration and partner management skills \- building deep, trust based relationships with territory and cross functional teams
* Experience with quantitative data analysis, deep measurable insights, modeling, and sophisticated test plan design and analysis
* High energy and motivational leadership driven by personal influence and example with direct staff, peers, and senior leaders across all company functions
Experience working closely and communicating effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders in a constantly evolving, rapid growth environment with tight deadlines  
* 

  

  

For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$186,000 per year \- USD$207,000 per year. You will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

jobs.title: Senior Operations Manager, Global Marketplace
jobs.description:
**About the Role**
  

  

We are looking for a strategic, data\-driven and execution\-oriented Operations Manager to join our Global Marketplace team supporting the Groceries \& Retail business. In this role, you will lead high\-impact initiatives to ensure marketplace reliability and performance by managing complex supply\-demand dynamics, surfacing root causes through deep analytics, and driving the product roadmap to improve courier experience, reliability, and cost efficiency.
  

  

You will work closely with cross\-functional partners in Product, Tech, Finance, Legal, Strategy, and Regional Operations, as well as collaborate across Restaurant and Direct verticals to drive alignment, scalability and innovation across Uber's Delivery ecosystem.
  

  

This is a unique opportunity for a seasoned operator with a bias for action, strong analytical rigor, and the ability to influence across levels and geographies.
  

  

**What You'll Do*** **Lead marketplace performance and reliability**: Define and monitor key KPIs related to supply health and reliability. Build scalable processes and data tools to proactively detect and mitigate imbalances across global markets.
* **Be a product and operations champion**: Act as the voice of operations in product discussions, advocating for features that improve courier engagement, earnings, and long\-term retention. Identify product gaps, define operational requirements, and partner with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to deliver effective solutions.
* **Lead dynamic pricing and demand\-shaping initiatives** to optimize growth and consumer engagement by using algorithmic pricing and delivery options; work cross\-functionally with Growth, Membership and Regional teams teams to analyze elasticity, implement price experiments, and adapt pricing tactics in real\-time to maximize marketplace revenue and consumer growth.
* **Drive investment and incentive strategy**: Contribute to the design and implementation of frameworks for pricing and incentive allocation that balance growth, reliability, and cost\-efficiency. Partner with Finance and Product to forecast investment needs and measure ROI.
* **Develop global playbooks and local strategies**: Collaborate with regional teams to adapt global strategies to local market realities, ensuring both scalability and relevance. Serve as the subject matter expert on marketplace mechanics for G\&R globally.
* **Own complex problem\-solving and insight generation**: Lead deep\-dive analyses to understand root causes of marketplace issues. Build and present compelling narratives backed by data to drive executive alignment and decision\-making.
* **Influence senior stakeholders and cross\-LOB coordination**: Partner with senior leaders across Delivery to align on investment priorities, product rollouts, and operational bets. Champion a One Uber" approach to supply and marketplace management.

**Basic Qualifications**
* 4\+ years of experience in Operations, Product Strategy, Analytics, or similar roles; ideally within tech, marketplaces, logistics, or consulting.
* Bachelor's degree required.
* Exceptional analytical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Excel; Python is a plus.

**Preferred Qualifications**
* MBA or advanced degree is a strong plus.
* Demonstrated ability to synthesize complex data into actionable insights and influence decision\-making at senior levels.
* Proven track record leading large\-scale, cross\-functional projects with measurable business impact.
* Strong product intuition and ability to bridge between technical and business teams.
* Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to tailor messaging to both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Experience in high\-growth, fast\-paced environments and a passion for solving ambiguous, high\-impact problems.
* Experience in marketplace businesses or logistics platforms.
* Familiarity with cost optimization frameworks and incentive economics.
Passion for building magical user experiences at scale.  
* 

  

  

For New York, NY\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$129,000 per year \- USD$143,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$129,000 per year \- USD$143,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

jobs.title: Sales Enablement Manager, Channel
jobs.description:
Location


New York
Employment Type


Full time
Location Type


Hybrid
Department


Sales
Compensation


$136\.6K – $187\.8K • Offers Equity



The final compensation will depend on the location and level at which the candidate is hired, as we are considering candidates for multiple levels for this role.
  
**About Ramp**
Ramp is a financial operations platform designed to save companies time and money. Our all\-in\-one solution combines payments, corporate cards, vendor management, procurement, travel booking, and automated bookkeeping with built\-in intelligence to maximize the impact of every dollar and hour spent. More than 40,000 businesses, from family\-owned farms to e\-commerce giants to space startups, have saved $10B and 27\.5M hours with Ramp. Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest\-growing corporate card and bill payment platform in America, and enables over $80 billion in purchases each year.

  

Ramp’s investors include Thrive Capital, Sands Capital, General Catalyst, Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Greylock, and Redpoint, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart.

  

Ramp has been named to Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies list and LinkedIn’s Top U.S. Startups for more than 3 years, as well as the Forbes Cloud 100, CNBC Disruptor 50, and TIME Magazine’s 100 Most Influential Companies.

 **About the Role**


We are looking for a Sales Enablement Manager, Channel to help drive Ramp’s next phase of growth. The objective of this role is to own the continued development and deployment of a best\-in\-class enablement to our Channel organization empowering our reps to become experts in evolving Product \& Systems knowledge, increase connectivity between our org and the Pre \& Post Sales teams, and codify our Rules of Engagement. This position reports directly to the Sr. Manager Finance \& Operations and partners with Sales, Strategic Finance, Business Systems, Product Marketing, and Solutions Consulting to identify key metric drivers that guide our Channel enablement strategy. This role is a mix of program management and hands\-on enablement \- we’re looking for someone who can think strategically about the needs of our business and is comfortable owning the full lifecycle of programming from development through delivery.

**What You’ll Do**

* Design and deliver multi\-modal training programs with a mix of live and in\-person, async learning, virtual workshops, coaching plans, certifications, playbooks, and more.
* Work inside the Ramp knowledge management system to launch and measure the effectiveness of content.
* Embed within cross\-functional teams in order to build detailed enablement for upcoming releases \- ensuring smooth release with reps and Channel leadership
* Structure and design a series of ROE documents that define our preferred method for reps to work within across multiple role types
* Own KPI tracking and reporting across post\-sales GTM functions to help improve time to productivity across multiple departments. Leverage BI tools (Looker), Gong, and SFDC reporting to track leading and lagging metrics.
* Identify and codify best practices that drive GTM success and improve time to productivity across segments and departments.

**What You’ll Need**

* Experience supporting an indirect sales funnel (Channel, Reseller, Partnerships, etc)
* Minimum of 4 years of related experience in sales enablement, sales onboarding program development, solutions consulting/sales engineering, or other related fields.
* Developed, launched, and scaled successful new hire onboarding or “everboarding” enablement programming for high\-velocity SaaS Sales, Account Management, and/or Solutions Consulting/Sales Engineering teams.
* Demonstrated capacity to act as a subject matter expert in the sales processes, skills, products, and customer base you previously supported.
* Demonstrated capacity to translate strategic business objectives into actionable enablement programming using First Principles Thinking.
* Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and large cross\-functional teams.
* Excellent communication and analytical skills with the ability to distill complex thoughts into simple, actionable recommendations.

**Nice to Haves:**

* Domain expertise in any of the following: Spend \& Expense Management, Accounts Payable, Accounting best practices, or Finance Technology
* Experience in a high\-growth startup environment
* Experience in a quota\-carrying role, ideally with consistent over\-performance as an individual contributor and/or people manager
* Experience using or administering Highspot or another CMS
* Experience using or administering LearnUpon or another LMS
* Experience in learning design using instructional design methodologies
* Experience measuring learning impact using frameworks and competency models

**Benefits (for U.S.\-based full\-time employees)**

* 100% medical, dental \& vision insurance coverage for you
	+ Partially covered for your dependents
	+ One Medical annual membership
* 401k (including employer match on contributions made while employed by Ramp)
* Flexible PTO
* Fertility HRA (up to $5,000 per year)
* WFH stipend to support your home office needs
* Wellness stipend
* Parental Leave
* Relocation support to NYC or SF
* Pet insurance

**Other notices**


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.


Ramp Applicant Privacy Notice

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Team**
  

  

The Search Platform team is responsible for the Search experience on several product surfaces at Uber, enabling millions of users to find, discover, and explore rides, food, etc. Search has played an increasingly important role in bringing Uber closer to its vision. The ideal candidate will bring extensive expertise in search infrastructure, showcasing a profound understanding of search algorithms, distributed systems, and scalability.  

  

Also this team is responsible for Metric platform serving all Uber monitoring, alerting, dashboarding use cases.  

  

**About the Role**
  

  

We are looking for an experienced Sr. Engineer to play a key role in refining and optimizing our search capabilities. You will get to work on cutting edge technologies and will get to work with industry experts ranging from distributed systems to machine learning.  

  

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**
\- What the Candidate Will Do \-  

* Design and implement new features in our search infrastructure solutions at Uber.
* Join on call rotation, driving continuous improvements on system availability, scalability, performance and efficiency.
* Collaborate with other infrastructure teams, product teams and product managers to drive adoption and standardize processes, and to design and implement high impact, cross\-product features.


\- Basic Qualifications \-  

* BS or MS in Computer Science and 5\+ years of related technical discipline or equivalent experience.
* Proficient in one of the following programming languages: Java, Go, C/C\+\+ or similar languages. Good scripting skills and ability to pick up new ones.
* Systematic problem solving approach and knowledge of algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.


\- Preferred Qualifications \-  

* Experience with Apache Lucene, ElasticSearch, OpenSearch, Solr and other Search technologies is a plus
* Experience with highly available/fault tolerant, replicated data storage systems, large scale data processing systems or enterprise/cloud storage systems is also a strong plus

  

For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For Sunnyvale, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

* BS or MS in Computer Science and 5\+ years of related technical discipline or experience.
* Proficient in one of the following programming languages: Java, Go, C/C\+\+ or similar languages. Good scripting skills and ability to pick up new ones.
* Systematic problem solving approach and knowledge of algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.

  

\- Preferred Qualifications \-  

* Experience with Apache Lucene, ElasticSearch, OpenSearch, Solr and other Search technologies is a plus.
* Experiences with VectorDB/VectorSearch is a plus.
* Experience with highly available/fault tolerant, replicated data storage systems, large scale data processing systems or enterprise/cloud storage systems is also a strong plus

  

For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For Sunnyvale, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.description:
**About the Team**
  

  

The Search Platform team is responsible for the Search experience on several product surfaces at Uber, enabling millions of users to find, discover, and explore rides, food, etc. Search has played an increasingly important role in bringing Uber closer to its vision. The ideal candidate will bring extensive expertise in search infrastructure, showcasing a profound understanding of search algorithms, distributed systems, and scalability.  

  

Also this team is responsible for Metric platform serving all Uber monitoring, alerting, dashboarding use cases.  

  

**About the Role**
  

  

We are looking for an experienced Sr. Engineer to play a key role in refining and optimizing our search capabilities. You will get to work on cutting edge technologies and will get to work with industry experts ranging from distributed systems to machine learning.  

  

**What the Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points**
\- What the Candidate Will Do \-  

* Design and implement new features in our search infrastructure solutions at Uber.
* Join on call rotation, driving continuous improvements on system availability, scalability, performance and efficiency.
* Collaborate with other infrastructure teams, product teams and product managers to drive adoption and standardize processes, and to design and implement high impact, cross\-product features.


\- Basic Qualifications \-  

* BS or MS in Computer Science and 5\+ years of related technical discipline or equivalent experience.
* Proficient in one of the following programming languages: Java, Go, C/C\+\+ or similar languages. Good scripting skills and ability to pick up new ones.
* Systematic problem solving approach and knowledge of algorithms, data structures and complexity analysis.


\- Preferred Qualifications \-  

* Experience with Apache Lucene, ElasticSearch, OpenSearch, Solr and other Search technologies is a plus
* Experience with highly available/fault tolerant, replicated data storage systems, large scale data processing systems or enterprise/cloud storage systems is also a strong plus

  

For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For Sunnyvale, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$198,000 per year \- USD$220,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Associate, Safety
jobs.description:
**About the Role**  

  

At Uber, we're committed to the safety of riders, drivers, couriers, and the communities we serve. As a product marketing manager focused on safety, you'll help surface the unique voices of riders, drivers, and couriers across the globe in order to help build better experiences for them on our platform.
  

  

Working hand\-in\-hand with cross\-functional partners across Policy, Communications, Product, Operations, and Marketing, you'll have the opportunity to build, develop, and scale comprehensive marketing strategies that scale globally. You'll be empowered to champion, build, and manage strategic initiatives that are core to specific local opportunities and needs.
  

  

**What You'll Do*** Own audience insights \- Synthesize consumer insights and industry perspectives on key aspects of trust and safety; identify and prioritize safety needs of specific audience segments for trust and safety awareness campaigns.
* Shape the product \- Help to shape the Safety Product team's roadmap, developing the positioning and messaging for new products, building go\-to\-market strategies, and owning the success of all safety intelligence products and features.
* Drive marketing development \- Oversee the creation of safety marketing awareness campaigns that span the globe, guiding the development of creative and engaging content that our consumers need and want. You will partner with a high\-performing cross\-functional team that includes counterparts in Product Management, Marketing, Product Design, Data Science, Engineering, Research, Operations, and Comms to meet shared objectives and key results.
* Measure for impact \- Working with product and marketing channels, test, iterate, and measure the impact campaigns have on awareness and adjust accordingly to optimize for results and KPIs.
* Evangelize new ideas \- Work with Product, PR, Policy, and Ops teams to champion safety marketing initiatives and partnerships. Lead effective conversations with cross\-functional alignment to build support.
* Make a difference \- Passion for creating empathetic, inspiring and innovative marketing for social impact causes.

**Basic Qualifications*** 3\+ years of marketing or product experience
* 2\+ years of product marketing experience delivering highly successful engagement and acquisition strategies for consumers
* Bachelor's degree
* Passion for safety and trust: You care deeply about building products that put safety at the heart of the experience, so that everyone can feel at ease using the platform. You're excited by the challenge of making safety features feel seamless, thoughtful, and empowering for all.

**Preferred Qualifications*** Penchant for data: You just go get the data you need and can whip it into an insightful story with no help. You know how to leverage data to make decisions and drive growth.
* Top\-notch at market research: You're a truth\-seeking missile. You know your market, customers, and competition better than anyone, and you integrate this information into your growth strategies.
* Master storyteller: You can craft a compelling narrative across different channels \- you know how to match the message to the medium.
* A "builder" personality: You're biased toward action, a great collaborator and master disambiguator/simplifier. You never stop pushing towards clarity and delivery.
* Incredible at articulating the essence of products and the value they create. You can make the most complex products incredibly simple for consumers to understand. You can develop a strong messaging hierarchy and an effective content strategy. You shine at copywriting.
* Grittiness: You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands\-on, you persevere when others fall away.
* History of Success: A demonstrated history of quickly, yet strategically, making an impact via tailored marketing approaches and experience successfully launching products with compelling and strategic marketing campaigns.
* Excellent project management skills with a keen attention to detail.
* An awesome and optimistic attitude. We work hard and have a blast doing it.
* Prior experience in safety, trust, crisis response, or social impact marketing.
* Influential with great communication skills
* Experience in planning, setting metrics, and roadmap development
* MBA or Master's degree is a plus
* Experience working in the prevention/education space
International experience  
* 

  

  

For New York, NY\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$108,000 per year \- USD$120,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$108,000 per year \- USD$120,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
**About Constellation:**



Constellation is a cutting\-edge AI solution that empowers highly regulated and complex industries with the insights and content they need to fuel their business. Specializing in industries such as healthcare, automotive, insurance, and finance, our powerful data/AI insights tools inform the creation of compliant content at scale. We enable our customers to harness their data and streamline the creation of localized, personalized content. A global, NYC\-based company, Constellation has been revolutionizing marketing technology and data intelligence in order to drive exponential growth since its founding in 2016\.



Constellation was named the 65th Fastest\-Growing Private Company in America, the 10th Fastest\-Growing Women\-Owned Private Company, and the 7th Fastest\-Growing Marketing \& Advertising Company by Inc 500\. In 2022, our platform won the Digiday Technology Award for Best Marketing Automation Platform.

### **About the Role**



We're looking for a strategic and operationally strong **Product Manager** to lead our campaign integrations pod. This is a high\-impact role for someone who can balance long\-term vision with day\-to\-day execution.



You'll partner closely with Tech Leads and UX Designers to define and deliver the strategy for our Campaigns module. This person will also work cross\-functionally with our internal media teams, sales, and customer success as well as customers to ensure that our campaign integrations are built based on key use cases and rolled out in a strategic way to internal and external stakeholders.


### **Key Responsibilities**


**Strategic Leadership \& Roadmapping**


* Own the product strategy, roadmap, and execution for our Campaigns Module.
* Drive cross\-functional alignment with engineering, design, GTM, and other pod leads to ensure platform cohesion.
* Oversee the development and integration of media\-related features and infrastructure
  


**Team Management \& Mentorship**


* Guide and mentor Associate Product Managers within your pod.
* Foster a high\-performing team culture focused on customer outcomes, platform stability, and business value.
* Provide structured feedback and support career development within the team.
  


**Operational Excellence**


* Partner with Tech Leads and Engineering Managers to drive sprint planning, backlog prioritization, and release processes.
* Ensure seamless rollout of features, including readiness checks for stability, usability, and support documentation.
* Maintain and manage comprehensive internal and external product documentation.
  


**Platform Cohesion \& Cross\-Team Coordination**


* Collaborate with other PM leads to ensure shared functionality functions consistently and efficiently across modules.
* Represent your product area in cross\-functional planning, leadership discussions, and business strategy meetings.
  


**Enablement \& Internal Evangelism**


* Serve as the go\-to expert for your product areas—leading internal trainings, demos, and client walk\-throughs.
* Ensure GTM teams are well\-supported with training content, release notes, and use\-case documentation.

Act as a product ambassador to both internal teams and strategic customers.  
* 

### **Qualifications**


**Required:**


* 3\-5\+ years of product management or related experience
* Strong background in **ad tech or martech** solutions, especially involving media channel integrations (paid and owned).
* Ability to work effectively across engineering, design, marketing, and support teams.
* Strong organizational skills, with proven ability to manage multiple product lines and team priorities simultaneously.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; comfortable presenting to leadership and clients.
  


**Preferred:**


* Hands\-on experience with creative platforms, media APIs (e.g., Google, Meta, DV360\), or dynamic content delivery systems.
* Familiarity with B2B SaaS platforms, user roles and permissions systems, or configurable client\-level settings.

Experience scaling platform infrastructure in a multi\-tenant or enterprise\-grade environment.  
* 

### **What Success Looks Like**


* Clear, cohesive strategy across all product modules within your pod group.
* High\-functioning pod, producing high\-impact, well\-scoped features on time.
* Smooth, low\-friction rollouts with high adoption and minimal rework.
* Platform experiences feel unified and intuitive across modules.
* You're seen as a thought leader and expert on your domain—inside and outside the organization.

### **Benefits**


* Comprehensive Healthcare, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Flexible PTO
* Hybrid work environment
* Casual in office dress code
* Competitive 401k plan with company match
* Commuter and Parking Benefits
* Paid Family Leave
* Uber Eats stipend, free snacks, and beverages
* Wellness programs and other employee perks


**New York Pay Range: $120,000\-145,000**



\#LI\-Hybrid: hybrid positions

jobs.title: Senior Operations Manager
jobs.description:
**Who We Are**



Nuro exists to better everyday life through robotics. Founded in 2016, Nuro has spent eight years developing autonomous driving (AD) technology and commercializing AD applications. The Nuro Driver™ is our world\-class autonomous driving system that combines AD hardware with our generalized AI\-first self\-driving software. Built to learn and improve through data, the Nuro Driver™ is one of the few driverless autonomous technologies on public roads today.



Nuro has raised over $2B in capital from Fidelity, Bailie Gifford, T. Rowe Price, Google, and other leading investors. We've partnered with some of the world's most respected brands including Uber, FedEx, Domino's, Walmart, Kroger, and 7\-Eleven.


**About the Role**  

  

We are seeking a Senior Operations Manager to spearhead our closed\-course testing and technical operations at our state\-of\-the\-art facility in Las Vegas. The closed course team plays a pivotal role in driving the success of Nuro's hardware, software, and commercialization objectives. As the primary on\-site leader, you will be instrumental in overseeing our R\&D testing endeavors and introducing new features and vehicle platforms. This role is paramount, requiring extensive expertise in team leadership, management, strategic planning, unwavering customer focus, technical proficiency, and resolute execution.


**About the Work**

  

* Oversee autonomous vehicles, managers, and test operators, ensuring paramount safety, performance, and efficiency.
* Set clear expectations, manage performance, and cultivate your team through dedicated coaching and mentorship.
* Serve as the primary point of escalation, advocating for your team and collaborating effectively across Hardware, Software, Autonomy, Product, Legal, and senior leadership.
* Drive strategy, OKRs, and organizational design, aligning team goals with Nuro's overarching company objectives.
* Foster a culture of safety, inclusion, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* Demonstrate strong judgment, independently solving complex cross\-functional problems and influencing key stakeholders with minimal oversight.
* Build scalable systems and processes, identify and develop top talent, and champion career advancement and team resilience.
* Provide technical leadership and direction to first\-line supervisors, upholding operational excellence and promoting a safety\-centric, inclusive, performance\-driven, and transparent culture through exemplary leadership.
* Collaborate with and provide feedback to various teams on new vehicle integration, testing, software development, external demonstrations, and partner visits.
* Lead strategic planning for the closed course team to ensure the development, achievement, and tracking of OKRs and KPIs.


**About You**

  

* **Experienced Business and Operations Leader:** Over 5\+ years of management experience, specializing in continuous improvement, data\-driven decision\-making, mentoring, managing managers of managers, and leading a diverse team.
* **Strategic and Relationship\-Oriented:** Skilled in navigating technical and business complexities, with a focus on building strong internal and external relationships. Proficient in leading major initiatives for clients and managing large stakeholder groups with oftentimes competing priorities.
* **Customer\-Centric and Collaborative:** Dedicated to ensuring customer success and understanding partner needs at all levels. Effective at managing multiple projects, processes, and teams simultaneously. Proactive in identifying and resolving challenges to drive team success.
* **Resourceful and Effective Communicator:** Willing to take hands\-on approaches to drive partner and team success. Possesses strong stakeholder management, communication, and coaching skills. Comfortable working cross\-functionally and with stakeholders at all levels.
* **Adaptable and Solutions\-Driven:** Thrives in ambiguous environments and enjoys being part of innovative teams. Solution\-oriented with a focus on delivering results through practical approaches.
* **People Developer with Strategic Focus:** Invests in team growth and development as the business expands. Works cross\-functionally to establish goals, milestones, and metrics of success. Owns execution and collaborates closely with other operational teams, product, engineering, commercial, and policy stakeholders. Engages deeply with software and hardware engineering teams to solve on\-the\-ground technical challenges and translate insights into actionable strategies for product development and strategy.
* **Safety Focused:** Prioritizes safety as a fundamental cornerstone, ensuring it remains at the forefront of all operations.


**Bonus Points**

  

* You have experience in the Autonomous Vehicle industry and are deeply familiar with the technical details of AV systems and HW
* You have familiarity and professional experience in machine learning
* You have experience working with both hardware and software
* You have experience in assessing safety risks and controlling those risks to meet mission requirements


At Nuro, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. For this position, the reasonably expected base pay range is between $100,320 and $150,480/year for the level at which this job has been scoped. Your base pay will depend on several factors, including your experience, qualifications, education, location, and skills. In the event that you are considered for a different level, a higher or lower pay range would apply. This position is also eligible for an annual performance bonus, equity, and a competitive benefits package.


*At Nuro, we celebrate differences and are committed to a diverse workplace that fosters inclusion and psychological safety for all employees. Nuro is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and expressly prohibits any form of workplace discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.*

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Remote
jobs.description:
**The Company**

  

Soundstripe is a premier music licensing platform used by more than a million creators and professionals globally to level up their creative works, including videos, podcasts and gaming experiences. Launched in 2016 by three professional musicians, the company helps fuel creativity for all types of customers, from amateur social creators to freelance filmmakers and podcasters to the world’s largest agencies and brands, including companies such as Microsoft, Uber, Adobe, Pepsico, Nike and Bud Light, just to name a few.

  

Since its inception, Soundstripe has issued more than 18 million content licenses from its diverse catalog of over 10,000 fully\-cleared songs and 50,000 song variations, as well as from its catalog of 70,000 sound effects and 100,000 video clips. The company is based in Nashville and its catalog is supported by a roster of award\-winning creators, including heavy hitters like Sam Barsh (Doja Cat, The Weeknd, Kendrick Lamar, etc), VAULTZ (Lorde, Maggie Rogers, etc), and Elise Solberg (Beyonce, Ellie Goulding, etc).

  

Soundstripe is a 5x winner of the Tennessean’s Top Workplace Award and a certified Great Place to Work. Learn more about us here.

 **The Opportunity**

  

We're seeking an Engineering Manager with deep experience across infrastructure, devops, cloud, and application development to join our fully remote team. While your primary focus will be on building, securing, and operating the robust systems that power Soundstripe, you’ll also be hands\-on in application development, collaborating across all corners of our product suite.

  

In this fluid and highly collaborative environment, you’ll guide a versatile team responsible for everything from the security and scalability of our core infrastructure, to delivering new features and improvements in our Rails web application, public API for enterprise customers, React Native mobile app, and creative extensions—like our Adobe Premiere tools and Twitch integration. You’ll work side\-by\-side with Product and Design, adapting to shifting priorities, and ensuring we deliver secure, reliable, and innovative solutions for all our users. If you’re a proactive, adaptable leader who thrives on variety, drives accountability, and values strong engineering culture in a distributed setting, we’d love to meet you.

  

How you’ll make an impact:

  

* Champion both the big picture and the small details—leading and supporting a team of engineers building and maintaining the vital infrastructure behind our products and services.
* Dig into code, config, and best practices when needed. You’re comfortable moving between architecting the next system, reviewing a pull request, and jumping into an incident call.
* Guide your team through technical challenges; whether it’s deploying a new cloud service, scaling our databases, or tightening security.
* Lead effective, high\-trust project planning, milestone delivery, and sprint execution, always looking for ways to make work smoother and more reliable.
* Be the guardian of operational excellence: implement, monitor, and continually improve our infrastructure, deployment pipelines, and security posture.
* Own our security practices. You’ll oversee everything from incident response to security audits, and help create a culture where everyone knows how to keep our apps and data safe.
* Inspire your team to grow: coach, mentor, perform reviews, and foster an environment of curiosity, learning, and honest feedback.
* Collaborate deeply with Product and Design, partnering on everything from feature planning to launch, and ensuring engineering’s voice is heard in every conversation.
* Contribute ideas, process improvements, technical guidance, and your unique energy in a fully remote, distributed environment.

  


**Who Will Love This Job**

  

A systems thinker and a fixer. You see the whole playing field. You get a kick out of connecting dots and jumping into thorny problems; be it a tricky SQL query, a critical incident, or a cross\-team product launch.

  

A curious innovator. You never settle for “that’s how we’ve always done it.” You actively look for ways to improve performance, security, and workflow for everyone on your team.

  

A devops\-minded leader. You are as comfortable talking about Rails best practices as you are discussing firewalls, cloud service orchestration, or load balancer configs.

  

A clear, open communicator. You can break down technical concepts for non\-engineers and facilitate honest, constructive conversations in a remote team.

  

A coach at heart. You’re excited to see others grow, and you love making your team feel seen, supported, and challenged.

  

A calm operator. When infrastructure quirks or security alerts threaten to throw a wrench in things, you keep your cool and inspire the same steady focus in others.

  

A culture champion. You lead with empathy, humility, and optimism. You genuinely care about the mission, the quality of our work, and the people you work with.

  

A passion for our stack. Deep Rails experience is a must; if you love working up and down the stack, even better.

  

And of course, you value what we value:


* Provide all customers with genuine and whimsical care.
* Confront harsh realities with optimism.
* Keep it light.
* Learn \& grow.
* Clear communication is kind.
* Make it better.
* Date the model, marry the mission.
* Be humble.
* Quality over quantity.
* Done is better than perfect.

  


**What to Expect**

  

As an Engineering Manager focused on infrastructure, security, compliance, and application development, you’ll help guide key areas that keep Soundstripe’s products running safely and smoothly. You’ll be joining a high\-performing, good\-natured, and adaptable team that values collaboration and works closely with Product, Design, and stakeholders from all parts of the company. We take our work seriously but keep the atmosphere light, celebrating wins (big and small), sharing the occasional meme, and always supporting each other along the way.



Soundstripe is a remote\-first company with a geographically distributed team. We collaborate daily using Slack, Zoom, and GitHub, which helps us stay connected and productive no matter which time zone we are in. Although there are a few chances for in\-person meetups each year, most of our work and teamwork happens virtually, and everyone is valued as an important part of the team.

 **What You Bring**

  

* Chances are, you’ve seen your share of launch celebrations and production fire drills—maybe that’s about a decade’s worth of hands\-on experience designing, building, and supporting real\-world web applications and the infrastructure behind them.
* Ruby on Rails? You not only speak its language, you think in it. (We do too; it’s the heart of our stack.) Sure, you probably have some other languages under your belt, but you’re happiest when Rails is home base.
* You’re no stranger to the essentials: Git, GitHub, and version control best practices are second nature to you. If you’ve ever rescued a teammate from a gnarly merge conflict, you’ll fit right in.
* You love working with APIs; integrating with third parties, revamping our endpoints, documenting for partners, and making sure our own Soundstripe API keeps purring for enterprise customers.
* Cloud\-native? Absolutely. You’ve spun up servers on Ubuntu (or cousins), wrangled databases (Postgres fans, take a bow), tinkered with GitHub Actions, and kept deployments running smoothly. Bonus points if you smile at the words “load balancer” or “server tuning.”
* Network devices don’t scare you. If anything, you’ve configured your share of firewalls, routers, switches, or caught a bug hiding in a DNS record.
* You have a “safety first” reflex. Whether it’s responding to security incidents or nudging a teammate to enable 2FA, you take security seriously, but you know how to make it approachable for your team.
* Working with product managers, designers, and everyone who cares about our users is something you enjoy. You see the big picture and help connect the dots across disciplines.
* Remote work isn’t new to you. Whether you’re in your home office, a coffee shop, or halfway across the country from your team, you know how to communicate, collaborate, and keep projects humming along.
* And finally, you know your way around modern cloud environments—whether it’s DigitalOcean, AWS, Cloud66, or Fastly, you’re comfortable building and operating production systems on these platforms, and you aren’t fazed by the rapidly changing toolchain and migrations.

  



If any of this resonates with you, we’d love to hear from you! Even more so if you also:

  

* Have dipped your toes (or dived in headfirst) into operating in PCI or GDPR\-compliant environments and know what it takes to keep things safe and auditable for everyone.
* Are already teaming up with Large Language Models or AI agents. Maybe you’re using them to write and review code, whip up documentation, supercharge testing, automate configs, brainstorm product ideas, or just make your day a little easier.
* Can show us your favorite agile moves—whether you’re a longtime fan of scrum, kanban, shape\-up, or something you invented to help teams move a little faster, smarter, and happier.

  



If you’ve made it this far and think, “Hey, that sounds a bit like me!” (even if you don’t check every single box), don’t be shy, say hello! We’re a team that’s serious about our craft but not about ourselves. If you’re passionate, curious, and ready to join a group that works hard, laughs often, and genuinely enjoys building cool things together, we can’t wait to meet you.

 **Disclaimer**

  

Soundstripe is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Soundstripe provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Soundstripe complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobs.title: Senior Operations Manager
jobs.description:
**Who We Are**



Nuro exists to better everyday life through robotics. Founded in 2016, Nuro has spent eight years developing autonomous driving (AD) technology and commercializing AD applications. The Nuro Driver™ is our world\-class autonomous driving system that combines AD hardware with our generalized AI\-first self\-driving software. Built to learn and improve through data, the Nuro Driver™ is one of the few driverless autonomous technologies on public roads today.



Nuro has raised over $2B in capital from Fidelity, Bailie Gifford, T. Rowe Price, Google, and other leading investors. We’ve partnered with some of the world’s most respected brands including Uber, FedEx, Domino’s, Walmart, Kroger, and 7\-Eleven.


**About the Role**  

  

We are seeking a Senior Operations Manager to spearhead our closed\-course testing and technical operations at our state\-of\-the\-art facility in Las Vegas. The closed course team plays a pivotal role in driving the success of Nuro’s hardware, software, and commercialization objectives. As the primary on\-site leader, you will be instrumental in overseeing our R\&D testing endeavors and introducing new features and vehicle platforms. This role is paramount, requiring extensive expertise in team leadership, management, strategic planning, unwavering customer focus, technical proficiency, and resolute execution.


**About the Work**

  

* Oversee autonomous vehicles, managers, and test operators, ensuring paramount safety, performance, and efficiency.
* Set clear expectations, manage performance, and cultivate your team through dedicated coaching and mentorship.
* Serve as the primary point of escalation, advocating for your team and collaborating effectively across Hardware, Software, Autonomy, Product, Legal, and senior leadership.
* Drive strategy, OKRs, and organizational design, aligning team goals with Nuro’s overarching company objectives.
* Foster a culture of safety, inclusion, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* Demonstrate strong judgment, independently solving complex cross\-functional problems and influencing key stakeholders with minimal oversight.
* Build scalable systems and processes, identify and develop top talent, and champion career advancement and team resilience.
* Provide technical leadership and direction to first\-line supervisors, upholding operational excellence and promoting a safety\-centric, inclusive, performance\-driven, and transparent culture through exemplary leadership.
* Collaborate with and provide feedback to various teams on new vehicle integration, testing, software development, external demonstrations, and partner visits.
* Lead strategic planning for the closed course team to ensure the development, achievement, and tracking of OKRs and KPIs.


**About You**

  

* **Experienced Business and Operations Leader:** Over 5\+ years of management experience, specializing in continuous improvement, data\-driven decision\-making, mentoring, managing managers of managers, and leading a diverse team.
* **Strategic and Relationship\-Oriented:** Skilled in navigating technical and business complexities, with a focus on building strong internal and external relationships. Proficient in leading major initiatives for clients and managing large stakeholder groups with oftentimes competing priorities.
* **Customer\-Centric and Collaborative:** Dedicated to ensuring customer success and understanding partner needs at all levels. Effective at managing multiple projects, processes, and teams simultaneously. Proactive in identifying and resolving challenges to drive team success.
* **Resourceful and Effective Communicator:** Willing to take hands\-on approaches to drive partner and team success. Possesses strong stakeholder management, communication, and coaching skills. Comfortable working cross\-functionally and with stakeholders at all levels.
* **Adaptable and Solutions\-Driven:** Thrives in ambiguous environments and enjoys being part of innovative teams. Solution\-oriented with a focus on delivering results through practical approaches.
* **People Developer with Strategic Focus:** Invests in team growth and development as the business expands. Works cross\-functionally to establish goals, milestones, and metrics of success. Owns execution and collaborates closely with other operational teams, product, engineering, commercial, and policy stakeholders. Engages deeply with software and hardware engineering teams to solve on\-the\-ground technical challenges and translate insights into actionable strategies for product development and strategy.
* **Safety Focused:** Prioritizes safety as a fundamental cornerstone, ensuring it remains at the forefront of all operations.


**Bonus Points**

  

* You have experience in the Autonomous Vehicle industry and are deeply familiar with the technical details of AV systems and HW
* You have familiarity and professional experience in machine learning
* You have experience working with both hardware and software
* You have experience in assessing safety risks and controlling those risks to meet mission requirements


At Nuro, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. For this position, the reasonably expected base pay range is between $100,320 and $150,480/year for the level at which this job has been scoped. Your base pay will depend on several factors, including your experience, qualifications, education, location, and skills. In the event that you are considered for a different level, a higher or lower pay range would apply. This position is also eligible for an annual performance bonus, equity, and a competitive benefits package.


*At Nuro, we celebrate differences and are committed to a diverse workplace that fosters inclusion and psychological safety for all employees. Nuro is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and expressly prohibits any form of workplace discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.*

jobs.title: Content Designer II - Rider
jobs.description:
**About the Role**
  

  

We're seeking a Content Designer to help shape the future of transportation with innovative, functional, and delightful experiences for Uber riders. Working with the Rider/Maps design team, you'll craft content strategies and UX copy that guide users through the app with clarity and ease. You'll collaborate closely with cross\-functional partners, advocate for user needs, and contribute to the growth of content design at Uber.
  

  

In this role, you'll focus on projects that require a balance of strategy, systems thinking, and creativity. You'll help establish the effective messaging and information architecture for features in the Rider/Maps space, drive alignment across teams, and ensure that every word reflects Uber's commitment to accessibility, inclusivity, and simplicity.
  

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design impactful content for app interfaces, guiding users through their journey with clear, concise, and engaging language
* Develop scalable frameworks that align with global user needs and business goals.
* Collaborate across disciplines, partnering with product managers, engineers, researchers, product designers, and product marketing managers to deliver cohesive end\-to\-end experiences
* Incorporate insights and data from research, user feedback, and analytics to validate and improve your work
* Advocate for accessibility principles, ensuring content is inclusive, localized, and aligned with Uber's global standards
* Contribute to team growth by developing content guidelines, sharing best practices, and helping scale content design at Uber
* Manage your time and priorities effectively, balancing multiple projects in a fast\-paced environment
* Develop content guidelines and other tools to grow the practice of content design at Uber

**Basic Qualifications**
* 3\+ years of relevant experience in content design ajd UX writing
* A portfolio demonstrating your ability to craft clear, impactful content for digital products
* Experience collaborating across cross\-functional teams to deliver user\-centered solutions

**Preferred Qualifications**
* A degree in English, Communication, Psychology, Design, Marketing, Journalism, or a related field emphasizing storytelling and critical thinking
* Experience designing for consumer\-facing products with an understanding of content design best practices
* Familiarity with localization, accessibility, and global content standards
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining quality and meeting deadlines
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to advocate for content decisions
Background in conversational content design is a plus  
* 

  

  

For New York, NY\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$152,000 per year \- USD$169,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$152,000 per year \- USD$169,000 per year. For Seattle, WA\-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$152,000 per year \- USD$169,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award \& other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.
